intro: Monoon congestum, commonly known as the clustered monoon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, providing a textured appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
